alert.note: Alert for Hancock (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...GUSTY RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS ALONG A COLD FRONT WILL IMPACT CARROLL...NORTHERN TUSCARAWAS... NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...COLUMBIANA...BEAVER... VENANGO...BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG... CLARION...FOREST...MERCER...LAWRENCE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking rain and snow showers with gusty winds along a line extending from near Enterprise to near Strasburg. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Castle, New Philadelphia, Hermitage, Sharon, Butler, Dover, Salem, East Liverpool, Oil City, Beaver Falls, Grove City, and Franklin. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 80 and 93. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 84 and 138. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 72. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Motorists should be prepared for changeable visibility.
